main_quest_state.timeline_notes: Campaign occurs after Alduin's defeat. Dragon crisis has ended, focus is on civil war and Thalmor conspiracy.

active_plots.description: Thalmor seeks to prolong civil war to weaken both sides

major_choices: Engaged and defeated Legate Rikke's perimeter knot via coordinated strike; forced her concession (she escaped).
Captured dispatch case: gained Battle of Whiterun tactical advantage.
Inflicted Sanies Lupinus exposure via bite to Rikke's hand during breakaway.
At the gate-breach, killed the conducting officer and seized his heart as trophy; used decapitation to shatter troop cohesion.
Ralof eliminated the horn wielder; Imperial withdrawal signaling disrupted.
Hadvar took a severe injury while rallying the reserve knot; ordered wounded retreat and accepted an honor duel to buy them time.
Hadvar was Taken Out in honorable single combat at Whiterun's gates; Khagar allowed the node's wounded retreat and ceded Hadvar's fate to Ralof (pending decision).
Hadvar Taken Out alive at the breach aftermath; Ralof chose custody; execution refused despite hardliner pressure.
Aela the Huntress conceded during rooftop engagement; Bitter Mercy recovered; Aela released under oath to withdraw to Jorrvaskr; Hunt-debt established.
Civilian evacuation corridor created toward the Temple of Kynareth during the push to Dragonsreach.
Khagar used public werebear transformation during Cloud District advance; Thalmor divination escalation completed.

starting_narrative: The party arrives in Whiterun as supporters of the Stormcloak Rebellion. Ralof, a Stormcloak soldier who recruited them to the cause, accompanies the party. Jarl Balgruuf has sided with the Empire, making Whiterun a target for liberation. The party joins Galmar Stone-Fist in preparing to assault the city and free it from Imperial control. The Battle of Whiterun is imminent, and Skyrim's future hangs in the balance.

pc_khagar_yal.line: A towering Orsimer, draped in snow-pelt and battle-iron—calm as a predator that already chose the outcome.
An orc in Nordic plate and Stormcloak-blue cloth, wearing a snow sabre cat like a crown. Nobody forgets that silhouette.
The spear's runes blink faintly. It's the kind of weapon that makes people speak softer without knowing why.
Your eyes catch on the sabre-cat pelt first—then the tusks—then the spear glowing like winter lightning.
He looks like a war-story that learned how to walk: fur, steel, and a spear that hums with cold light.
The spear's runes blink faintly. It's the kind of weapon that makes people speak softer without knowing why.
The spear's runes blink faintly. It's the kind of weapon that makes people speak softer without knowing why.
Aela watches the spear before she watches the orc—like she recognizes the Hunt in the metal.
